title: Great!
comment: Excellent app for budding graphics coders!

title: GLSL
comment: Edit and preview shader code, and seamlessly use your scripts as dynamic wallpaper, responsive to touch. Editor is basic but functional--no file/open, autocomplete, or language help--but the live preview is nice. The wallpaper widget in particular makes this a must-have for any GLSL programmer.

title: 5 Stars Must Have & Idea
comment: As an OpenGl and GLSL programmer this is an amazing must have app!

title: Wow!
comment: This is fantastic. Is there a way to have an image drawn on the screen to apply the shader to that? If not, it would be great to be able to select an image on the device and have it drawn to the screen. I will update to 5 stars if an image can be added!
Very good tool for practising / testing shaders

title: A fantastic mobile creative tool!
comment: It's the perfect application for being mathematically creative anywhere. It's tons of fun and manages to be engaging and useable despite the pain that is coding on a phone touch keyboard. Only bug I've noticed: The battery uniform does not seem to update for live backgrounds.

title: Love it
comment: Really nice app, use it all the time when I'm on a train ride or killing time. The live wallpaper integration is really nice as well. Feature request: ability to import custom textures!

title: Great app but update caused some issues
comment: This is the best shader sandbox I've used on Android but the latest update seems to have broken backbuffer effects. Simple effects like Conway's Game of Life are flickering badly on both my Nexus 4 and Nexus 7 2013 but worked fine before. EDIT: Update fixed the issue works great now.
Thanks for the feedback. The most recent update, Version 1.6.3 from March 22, should fix this issue.

title: Great App
comment: Love this app, it would be awesome if it could pull shaders off of shadertoy, or even upload them. (Shadertoy now has a Web API too)

title: Lolipop
comment: This most recent update added a dedicated menu button in the action bar. I no longer have problems opening the menu. Thank you so much for creating and maintaining this app.

title: Awesome
comment: But if you add textures, maybe geometry, and some more options, this would be perfect!

title: Awesome
comment: Now, if it would lend you a bit more tools like the ability of adding textures to read or write into, or use the home screen on rooted devices for creating cool animations; or maybe even have options to write geometry or vertex shaders. Anyway, one can only dream, overall it is a great app and I thank you for it. A certain elegance and a fine sense for details can definitely be seen from the start.  One last thing thou, can there be an option to use Tab as a character and not a navigational key for those with physical keyboards? It is totally annoying, but there might be something I miss to see.
Amazing app !

title: Needs tutorials
comment: This is a really cool thing, but it seems that a lot of people (including me) aren't well versed in programming, so it would be good to have some kind of function to help newbs along.

title: Great app
comment: Works well on note 3 octa. Get 60 fps on default settings. Cool app

title: Epic!
comment: Coding shaders on the go :D

title: Could use improvements
comment: Great that it's open source, but it should have features that make it act as a good shader editor like shader toy websites. Eg enable sampling from chosen sampler/textures, and make a way to stop the background. If you at your shader to all white you can't see anything in the editor. You should separate code and testing, they're 2 separate activities, please don't merge then like that.

title: Amazing
comment: I only wish it came with a manual or quick reference sheet.

title: It's fun to play with shader
comment: it's really cool to play with shader while I ride the train home, though, I don't have much knowledge, a help button would be cool as a reminder of what are the functions available (Like the help on shadertoy)

title: one sugestion
comment: add more examples, like drawing circles or other object, and links to tutorial. thanks!

title: application work but not usable
comment: when i run application processor eats battery.  what  can i do with  full cpu load? i think that application need setting to disable rendering while typing! i ha e the same problem with adreno200.

title: Amazing!
comment: If you're a graphics programmer with an android device, you MUST get this! It gives you so much power. I've written a ray tracer for my wallpaper, just because I can!  The only negative is that writing code on a touch-screen is a bit frustrating, but that's hardly the app's fault.
